content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The main target image shows a structure composed of 3 building blocks:
- 1 blue cube in the center
- 2 orange triangular/wedge-shaped blocks positioned on either side of the blue cube

The structure has 1 layer with all blocks placed on the ground plane.

## Spatial Relationships
- The blue cube is positioned in the center of the structure
- One orange triangular block is attached to the left side of the blue cube
- Another orange triangular block is attached to the right side of the blue cube
- Together, they form a structure that looks like a blue cube with orange triangular "wings" or ramps on each side

# Required Blocks from the Dictionary

Based on my analysis, I need the following blocks from the dictionary:
- Block with index 1: The blue cube in the center
- Block with index 12: The orange triangular/wedge block for the right side
- Block with index 13: The orange triangular/wedge block for the left side

The orientation of these blocks matches exactly what is needed for the target structure.

# Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 13
   Step2: Move block with index 1
   Step3: Move block with index 12
}
```

This sequence places the left orange wedge first, then the blue cube in the center, and finally the right orange wedge, completing the structure as shown in the main target image.
